project.name: PTNA - Public Transport Network Analysis
project.description: PTNA provides a daily analysis of public transport lines mapped in OSM. Such lines are described in OSM by relations of type 'route' and 'route_master' and the categories 'train', 'subway', 'bus'. The analyzes are carried out for selected areas and networks.

tags.description: Allow 'route_master' = 'coach' and 'route' = 'coach' (although they are inofficial).
Allow 'route_master' = 'coach' and 'route' = 'coach' (although they are inofficial).

Ways are used which cannot be used explicitly or implicitly ('construction', 'access', ...) and where 'bus' = 'yes', 'bus' = 'designated', 'bus' = 'official', 'psv' =' yes', ... is not set. This applies to 'barrier' = '...' as well.
'highway' = 'bus_stop' can be set on nodes only, not on ways or areas.
Check 'gtfs:*' tags for validity, ...
Check 'gtfs:*' tags for validity, ...
Check of 'name' = '...ref: from => to' respectively 'name' ='...ref: from => via => ... => to'.
Check the value of 'network', ... whether the separator is actually the semicolon ';' (w/o Blanks).
Check that for instance 'bus' = 'yes' is set on a PTv2 bus stop having 'public_transport' = 'platform'. PTv2 does not require this though.
Check whether the tag 'route_ref' on the stops of a route includes the value of 'ref' of the route (provided 'route_ref' exists).
Check value of 'service' tag for 'highway' = 'service'. Suspicious values: 'drive-through', driveway', 'emergency_access', 'parking_aisle'
Check that for instance 'bus' = 'yes' is set on a PTv2 bus stop having 'public_transport' = 'stop_position'.
Check of 'public_transport:version' = '...' on Route-Master and Route.
Check whether the used way types are appropriate for the vehicle type ('train' using 'railway' = 'rail', 'tram' using 'railway' = 'tram', 'bus' using 'highway' = '...', ...).
SketchLine considers the value of 'colour' = '...' of Route-Master or Route.
Take this value as GTFS feed for option 'link-gtfs' if the relation does not provide the tags 'gtfs:feed', 'operator:guid' or 'network:guid'.
Take this value as GTFS feed for option 'link-gtfs' if the relation does not provide the tags 'gtfs:feed', 'operator:guid' or 'network:guid'.
Take this value as GTFS feed for option 'link-gtfs' if the relation does not provide the tags 'gtfs:feed', 'operator:guid' or 'network:guid'.
Provide links to GTFS-Analysis for 'gtfs:route_id' or 'gtfs:trip_id' tags.
Provide links to GTFS-Analysis for 'gtfs:route_id' or 'gtfs:trip_id' tags.
Check that for instance 'bus' = 'yes' is set on a PTv2 bus stop having 'public_transport' = 'platform'. PTv2 does not require this though.
